Records

Class RecordHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • Records.RecordHandler

  • public class RecordHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class loads, saves, and manages all records.

    Overview of a record:

    Each record consists of a name, length, and a set of notes, each with a pitch and rhythm. The length corrosponds to how many notes are in a record. The value of the pitch corrosponds to the frequency of a note: 1 is the lowest value, 13 is the highest value. The "rhythm" is an inverse measure of durration: 4 means it the note is a quarter note, 1 means it is a whole note, etc.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RecordHandler()
      When constructed, all records are loaded from the Records.jm file.

      • save

        public void save()
        This saves all records to the Records.jm file.

      • addRecord

        public void addRecord(java.lang.String name)
        Adds a record. The record is not saved in the Records.jm file until save() is called.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the record that will be added.

      • changeRecord

        public void changeRecord(java.lang.String name)
        Changes the current record to a different one.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the record that will be the current record.

      • removeRecord

        public void removeRecord(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a record. This change is not saved in the records.jm file until save() is called.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the record that will be removed.

      • numRecords

        public int numRecords()
        Returns the total number of records there are.
        Returns:
        The number of records there currently are.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name(int index)
        Returns the name of a record at a given index. Helpful for displaying the names of all records.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of a record.
        Returns:
        The name of the record at the given index.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name()
        Returns the name of the current record.
        Returns:
        The name of the current record.

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the length of the current record. Basically, it returns how many notes are in the current record.
        Returns:
        The length of the current record.

      • getPitch

        public int getPitch(int index)
        Returns the pitch of a note at a given index, within the current record.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getRhythm

        public int getRhythm(int index)
        Returns the rhythm of a note at a given index, within the current record.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of a note.
        Returns:
        The rhythm of the note at the givan index.

      • setLength

        public void setLength(int length)
        Sets the length of the current record. Basically, it sets how many notes the record will have. The length can not be less than 1.
        Parameters:
        length - The length that the current record will have.

      • setPitch

        public void setPitch(int index,
                     int p)
        Sets the pitch of a note at a given index, within the current record.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of a note.
        p - The pitch the note at the given index will have.

      • setRhythm

        public void setRhythm(int index,
                      int r)
        Sets the rhythm of a note at a given index, within the current record.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of a note.
        r - The rhythm the note at the given index will have.

      • startRecording

        public void startRecording()
        Begins recording. Recording allows for the pitch of each note in the current record to be set from beginning to end.

      • addPitch

        public void addPitch(int p)
        If recording, sets the pitch of the next note in the current record. If the end of the record is reached, stops recording.
        Parameters:
        p - The pitch that may be added to the current record.

      • isRecording

        public boolean isRecording()
        Returns if the RecordHandler is curretnly recording.
        Returns:
        True if currently recording; else, False.

      • startRecalling

        public void startRecalling()
        Begins Recalling. "Recalling" allows for the rhythm and pitch of each note in the current record to be returned from beginning to end.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns weather there is another note to recall.
        Returns:
        True if there is another note to recall; else, False.

      • nextPitch

        public int nextPitch()
        If recalling, returns the pitch of the next note in the current record. If the end of the record has been reched, ends recording. If the next pitch is not returned, returns -1.
        Returns:
        The next pitch in the record.

      • thisRhythm

        public int thisRhythm()
        If recalling, returns the rhythm of this note in the current record. Else: returns -1.
        Returns:
        The rhythm of this note.

      • isRecalling

        public boolean isRecalling()
        Returns whether or not the RecordHandler is recalling.
        Returns:
        True if recalling; else, False.
